skill.name: dependency-auditor
skill.description: Automated security auditing of project dependencies to identify known vulnerabilities.
skill.summary: Automated security auditing of project dependencies to identify known vulnerabilities.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructions and documentation. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities detected. This skill provides guidance for dependency security auditing through AI-assisted prompts.

content.value_statement: Outdated and vulnerable dependencies pose serious security risks to applications. This skill helps identify, assess, and remediate dependency security issues across Node.js, Python, Go, Ruby, Java, and .NET ecosystems.
actual_capabilities: Scan dependency files for known vulnerabilities across multiple ecosystems
Classify vulnerabilities by severity (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
Check for outdated packages and deprecated dependencies
Analyze transitive dependencies and supply chain risks
Suggest safe version upgrades and remediation steps
Review license compatibility and package integrity
limitations: Does not execute commands or modify files directly
Cannot access private vulnerability databases without user permission
Results depend on official advisory databases (NVD, GitHub, npm)
User must run actual audit commands (npm audit, pip-audit) for verification

use_cases.title: Automated vulnerability triage
use_cases.description: Streamline security reviews by generating comprehensive dependency audit reports with prioritized remediation plans.

use_cases.title: CI/CD security integration
use_cases.description: Add dependency security checks to deployment pipelines with guidance on configuring automated scanning tools.

use_cases.title: Proactive dependency management
use_cases.description: Identify and fix vulnerable dependencies before they reach production with actionable upgrade paths.

prompt_templates.title: Basic audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @dependency-auditor to scan my project for known vulnerabilities. Check package.json (or requirements.txt/go.mod) and identify any CVEs.

prompt_templates.title: Critical fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: @dependency-auditor --severity critical. Show me only critical vulnerabilities with remediation steps I can apply immediately.

prompt_templates.title: License compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: @dependency-auditor --check-licenses. Review all dependencies and flag any licenses that may cause compliance issues.

prompt_templates.title: Supply chain
prompt_templates.prompt: @dependency-auditor --supply-chain. Check for suspicious packages, typosquatting attempts, and verify maintainer authenticity.

best_practices: Run dependency audits regularly (at least weekly) and after adding new packages
Prioritize fixing critical and high severity vulnerabilities within 24-72 hours
Use exact versions in production (no ^ or ~) and commit lock files to version control
anti_patterns: Ignoring low severity vulnerabilities - they can be chained for privilege escalation
Blindly running npm audit fix without reviewing breaking changes
Adding dependencies without reviewing their maintenance status, popularity, and security history

faq.question: Which package ecosystems does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports Node.js/npm, Python (pip), Go (modules), Ruby (Bundler), Java (Maven), and .NET. Each ecosystem has specific audit commands and tools.

faq.question: What vulnerability databases does it check against?
faq.answer: References National Vulnerability Database (NVD), GitHub Advisory Database, npm Security Advisories, and Snyk Vulnerability Database.

faq.question: Can this skill update dependencies automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidance and commands for remediation, but users must review and execute updates manually to ensure stability.

faq.question: Does this skill send my dependency data to external services?
faq.answer: No. The skill only analyzes dependency files locally and provides recommendations. No data is transmitted to external services.

faq.question: Why does the skill reference shell commands?
faq.answer: The skill includes command examples (npm audit, pip-audit) as reference for users who want to run scans directly or integrate into CI/CD.

faq.question: How is this different from tools like Snyk or Dependabot?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted analysis and guidance. Dedicated tools offer automated scanning, alerts, and pull requests. Use both for comprehensive coverage.
